intro: Romulea biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with prominent, spurred petals. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Romulea biflora is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
